Estimate temperature at a specified height under neutral conditions

Source: R/TempWindProfileFunctions.R
air_temp_profile_neutral.Rd

calculate temperature (C) at a specified height (m) within a boundary layer near the surface. The velocity profile is the neutral profile described by Sellers (1965). Function in equations (2) and (3) of Porter et al. (1973). Source: Porter WP et al. 1973. Behavioral implications of mechanistic ecology. Oecologia 13:1-54.

air_temp_profile_neutral(T_r, zr, z0, z, T_s)

Arguments

T_r

is temperature at reference height in C.

zr

is initial reference height in m.

z0

is surface roughness in m.

z

is height to scale to in m.

T_s

is surface temperatures in C.

Value

temperature (C)

See also

Other microclimate functions: air_temp_profile_segment(), air_temp_profile(), degree_days(), direct_solar_radiation(), diurnal_radiation_variation(), diurnal_temp_variation_sineexp(), diurnal_temp_variation_sinesqrt(), diurnal_temp_variation_sine(), estimate_radiation(), monthly_solar_radiation(), partition_solar_radiation(), proportion_diffuse_solar_radiation(), surface_roughness(), wind_speed_profile_neutral(), wind_speed_profile_segment()

Examples

air_temp_profile_neutral(T_r=20, zr=0.1, z0=0.2, z=0.15, T_s=25)
#> [1] 18.09909
